required_header.download_date: ClinicalTrials.gov processed this data on November 19, 2021
required_header.link_text: Link to the current ClinicalTrials.gov record.

clinical_study.brief_title: Efficacy and Safety of Dapagliflozin in Children With Proteinuria
clinical_study.official_title: Efficacy and Safety of Dapagliflozin in Non-diabetic Children With Proteinuria

brief_summary.textblock: The purpose of the study is to investigate the antiproteinuric effect of Dapagliflozin in children with proteinuria.

primary_outcome.measure: The change in 24-hr proteinuria after a 4 weeks treatment with dapagliflozin
primary_outcome.description: Urine will be collected for 24 hours and total urinary protein will be detected

secondary_outcome.measure: The change in 24-hr proteinuria after a 12 weeks treatment with dapagliflozin
secondary_outcome.description: Urine will be collected for 24 hours and total urinary protein will be detected

secondary_outcome.measure: The change in eGFR after a 12 weeks treatment with dapagliflozin
secondary_outcome.time_frame: Measured at baseline, weeks 4, weeks 8, weeks 12
secondary_outcome.description: eGFR are repeated measurement data and will be evaluated by Schwartz formula（k*height（cm)/creatinine(umol/L), k=36.5）

intervention.description: Dapagliflozin will be given 5mg per day (weight≤30kg) or 10mg per day (weight>30kg), for 12 weeks
